message: but only after a save
This is typically text that won't change much so it has nothing to do inside a ruleset and should be put inside a "use javascript resource" or so
the thing is we only need one language at a time, so no need to load everything
we need a more  dynamic "use javascript resource" so we can load just the needed language file
in the appbuilder everything looks fine
The text above is for making an app multilingual
for example
becomes
splitting the files would be a nice feature, but I wouldn't worry about it now, unless your files are that huge.
unless the file is huge, there usually isn't a big speed difference for js files.
just the multilingual data
it declares 21 languages. If I could split it I would only load 10k
anything less then 20k downloads at roughly the same speed, as most of the time is spent doing everything else but transfering the bits.
the language data in FFixer ( a nice greasemonkey app I am porting) has a weight of 244k
Note that the js returned from the webhooks endpoint will not have the proper cache headers set, so there may not be the gain expected.
that is pretty huge, and a split might be worth it.
i am thinking about using localstorage
i confirm that the file doesn't get cached
grrrrrrr
2 problems I see
localstorage might act like a place where app resources would be stored ( at install time ) and an app would only load the dynamic part on KNS
and security
localstorage isn't too bad of an idea.
localstorages could also be seen as peer-to-peer app repositories...
the 5 mb limit for each domain
